Principal’s Message
Mr. Nicholas Rickford
Welcome to Sunmarke School – Where Amazing Happens
It is with great pleasure that I welcome you to Sunmarke School, a place where tailored academic pathways, innovative Signature Programmes and a holistic approach to Positive Education converge to provide an outstanding educational experience for your child.
At Sunmarke, we understand that every student is unique, with their own strengths, interests and aspirations. That is why we have developed a wide range of academic pathways that allow us to cater to the individual needs of every student. We are one of the very few schools to offer students the choice of A Level, IB Diploma, IB Career-related Programme and BTEC. By providing such enviable options and personalising learning experiences, we empower students to explore their passions and reach their full potential in a supportive and dynamic environment.
One of our key areas of focus is Science, Technology, Engineering, Arts and Mathematics. Our STEAM and Design Thinking curriculum fosters creativity, critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Through hands-on projects, collaborative learning and exposure to real-world applications, Sunmarke students engage with virtual reality, learn how to code and develop the essential skills of tech literacy and digital fluency.
As we prepare students for the future, we recognise the vital role that artificial intelligence (AI) plays in our society. We embrace AI, incorporating it into our curriculum and enabling learners to consider the limitless possibilities and ethical considerations associated with this transformative technology. Through our innovative AI programmes, students gain practical experience, develop computational thinking skills and become equipped to navigate the AI-driven world of tomorrow.
Our other Signature Programmes provide further opportunities for Sunmarke students to explore their interests and talents in specialised areas. From Performing Arts, Media and Communication to the Global Language Academy and Environment and Sustainability (which includes the incredible Forest School), our signature offerings inspire students to delve deep into their passions, develop expertise and build a strong sense of compassion and social responsibility.
At Sunmarke, we are extremely proud to offer a world-class, comprehensive Positive Education programme. We believe that academic success is intricately linked to emotional wellbeing, character development and the cultivation of positive relationships. Our PosEd framework fosters resilience, empathy and a growth mindset. Through mindfulness practices, character education and social-emotional learning, we enable all our students to thrive academically, emotionally and socially.
I invite you to explore our website to learn more about our academic strengths, unrivalled Signature Programmes and Positive Education approach. We look forward to partnering with you in nurturing your child’s intellectual curiosity, fostering their passions and equipping them for the future. In joining Sunmarke, your family will become part of a forward-thinking, vibrant and welcoming community “Where Amazing Happens”.
Warm regards,
Nicholas Rickford
Principal

British Values
As a British Schools Overseas (BSO) accredited school, Sunmarke School is committed to upholding the values and standards of a world-class British education. This includes a strong focus on the spiritual, moral, social and cultural development of our students, as well as the promotion of respect, tolerance, and responsibility. These principles align seamlessly with the values of the UAE, where respect for diversity and cultural understanding form the foundation of daily life. Together, these shared values shape our school community into one that is inclusive, aspirational, and globally minded.
Rule of Law
– School policies, codes of conduct, and classroom expectations help pupils understand fairness, responsibility, and the importance of living within agreed rules, reflecting the laws of the UAE.
Individual Liberty
– We encourage independence and student choice in learning, while ensuring safety and guidance so pupils understand the balance between rights and responsibilities.
Mutual Respect
– Our Positive Education ethos, house system, and community partnerships promote kindness and respect in daily interactions across the school.
Tolerance of Different Faiths and Beliefs
– We celebrate the UAE’s cultural and religious diversity, providing opportunities to learn about and respect different traditions while remaining rooted in our own values.
Student Voice & Representation
– Pupils are given a voice through Student Council, Sports Leaders, and other leadership opportunities, ensuring they understand the importance of fairness, collaboration, and shared decision-making.

We offer rigorous, ambitious and holistic education emphasising academic excellence and participation in diverse extracurricular activities enabling children to achieve outstanding academic, social and personal success in a stimulating and supportive environment.
Outstanding Senior Leaders & Teachers
All our inspiring senior leaders, teachers and staff are trained in Positive Education and best practices in education, and are provided continuous professional development and training to keep abreast of the latest developments in pedagogy.
Over Four Decades of History
Built on the foundation of Fortes Education’s four decades of excellence in education, Sunmarke’s dynamic management team bring their rich experience and knowledge to deliver the best value-based education for students.

A Positive Education School
A Philosophy Where Character Strengths Underpin Academic Excellence
Truly outstanding education is not just about academic and personal achievements but also about the development of character, values, and wellbeing. This is the essence of Positive Education (PosEd).
A scientifically-proven concept, PosEd is causing a paradigm shift in global education where parents, schools and governments realise the need to increase a child’s ‘wellbeing’ to raise his/her levels of ‘achievement’.
PosEd brings together the science of Positive Psychology combined with the best teaching practices to enable individuals, schools, and communities to flourish, be resilient, creative, successful and happy.
Sunmarke – A Character-Building School
Multiple studies on the effects of PosEd testify that improved levels of a child’s wellbeing are associated with higher levels of academic engagement, social skills, optimism, behaviour, and fewer mental health-related issues.
Positive Education – Sunmarke’s DNA
Positive Education (PosEd) is not an additional subject at Sunmarke but it’s woven into the fabric of the international school’s culture and is reflected in all its activities and teaching mechanisms. Sunmarke’s teachers undergo an intense training programme before entering the classroom where they learn, live, teach and embed Positive Education.
This is what our teachers say about the Positive Education training they receive at Sunmarke:
“Where amazing happens.  A motto that at first glance just appears to be some words to attract parents to send their children to Sunmarke school, almost like a gimmick.  Over the past 3 days for me amazing did happen.   The positive education training took me on a journey of self-discovery, showing me that changing my mindset can bring positive outcomes. I realized I have the power to make a difference in people’s lives. This training was the best I’ve ever received from a school, as they genuinely cared about us, ensuring we could apply what we learned in teaching and at home. It was an incredible experience, especially since I used to dislike training due to its lack of usefulness. This was entirely different – truly helpful, purposeful, and enlightening. It taught me to believe in the potential of education to inspire change.”
“The breadth of knowledge, evidence-based theories, outstanding coordination and delivery, and just everything about this week was outstanding! I was blown away in every way possible and feel so supported, valued, and appreciated.”

SUNMARKE'S WELLBEING & COUNSELLING TEAM
Our PosEd and wellbeing approach fosters deep trust in our school community, creating a safe, welcoming and nurturing environment. We embed various initiatives into the daily routines, curriculum and extracurricular activities to establish a personal, social and academic support system each child needs to flourish.
Class and Form Tutors, Heads of Year, and Subject teachers support students every day through direct teaching, mentoring, workshops and assemblies. The  Counselling Department provides compassionate care for children who may require professional support and or simply a sympathetic listening ear.
Students and parents both have access to a School Counsellor. A ‘Wellbeing Champion’ represents the school leadership in our Parent Association and ‘Friends of Sunmarke School’ (FOSS) group while the popular monthly ‘Wellness Wednesday’ event raises awareness among parents about crucial topics like strength-based parenting, raising children in the digital age and health and nutrition.

Part of the award-winning group of Fortes Education Schools and located within Sunmarke’s campus, Jumeirah International Nurseries (JINS) enables a smooth and seamless transition into the Early Years Foundation Stage (EYFS) at Sunmarke School.
With over 40 years of Early Years excellence, JINS Early Childhood Centre provides an inspiring British education that nurtures the hearts and minds of children aged 45+ days old and sparks infinite potential in all our little learners.

Our curriculum is further enriched with STEAM and Positive Education to set the stage for an exciting journey of discovery.
Our Early Years Experts create authentic and meaningful learning experiences that embrace the individuality of each child, allowing them to progress and flourish based on their unique interests, abilities and aptitude.

Children at JINS Sunmarke, JVT, have access to large, Reggio-inspired classrooms and a shared courtyard to which all classroom doors open, making it a welcoming space where children explore through sensory and physical play whilst also forging a strong connection with nature through our outdoor mud kitchen and garden areas.
Learning Through Play
Our passionate educators create joy-filled learning experiences where children ‘learn through play’ and hands-on activities that enhance their understanding and comprehension of the world around them. Our open-ended Reggio-inspired learning resources encourage creativity and problem-solving and enable our children to become confident and independent little learners.
Outstanding Care
The wellbeing of our children and families is at the heart of what we do. We’re committed to exceeding and maintaining the highest international standards of quality and safety in early childhood education.
We are proud holders of the
ISO 9001 Certification (Quality Systems)
and are the only Nursery in the UAE with the

At JINS, we follow the below rigorous health and safety procedures at our Early Childhood Centres:
Clean, fresh, and sanitised learning environments
Child-friendly changing facilities and toilets located within the classroom
Inculcating children with practices of good hygiene throughout the day
A full-time nurse on site
Doctor visits twice a week
Stringent security measures with identifiable lanyards for all adults (parents/visitors/staff) to wear at all times
Security gates surrounding the nursery externally and internally
All families are invited for a staggered entry week allowing a smooth and steady start for children
Transition to Big School
At JINS JVT, we help our children develop and secure skills which will be essential for a smooth transition into EYFS at Sunmarke School at the age of 3.
We support our young learners as they develop pre-writing and literacy skills and build their knowledge of important mathematical concepts through play and exploration. Children learn how to identify and write their own names and are introduced to the Letters and Sounds and Accelerated Maths Programme.
On a day-to-day basis, the children are encouraged to be independent, think critically, ask questions, and use their imagination as they learn and explore together.
In addition to this, our children regularly go across and experience the learning spaces in EYFS at Sunmarke School in the Summer Term, allowing them to acclimatise to new environments, practitioners, peers, routines, and levels of expectation. During these ‘Transition Days’ children experience the Forest Schools in EYFS at both schools, visit the libraries and play spaces, and enjoy specialised lessons such as Physical Education and Music.

Subject Offerings Rooted in STEAM ( Science, Technology, Engineering, Art & Mathematics) and Creative Learning
Our innovative curriculum prepares students to make the right choices in Year 10. As an inclusive school, Sunmarke offers a wide range of options at Key Stage 4. Through offering GCSE, IGCSE, and BTEC courses, we are able to accommodate a wide range of learning styles, whilst ensuring the level of challenge is such that all post-16 pathways remain open to students.
GCSE examinations are the mainstay of an English education, with most students following this pathway. At Sunmarke we also offer IGCSE examinations; the ‘I’ stands for international and means the course has been adapted to suit a more international student body. The difficulty level of GCSE and IGCSE exams are the same, but the content of GCSE examinations is more English-centred. A good example of this would be in Business Studies where the case studies for a GCSE would be UK companies, which many of our students would not have heard of. This is why we follow the IGCSE pathway for Business Studies, meaning the case studies focus on large multi-national companies all our students would know.
BTEC courses are as challenging as GCSE course but are assessed in a different manner. All BTEC courses are coursework based, with students undertaking assessed units every 12 weeks or so, these are all graded, and the outcome is the sum of these assessments. BTEC courses suit students who prefer to ‘chunk’ their assessments rather than taking one or two summative exams at the end of the course which determine their final outcome.

A-Levels
An Internationally Recognised Qualification Focusing On Content-Driven Academic Subjects
Why study A-Levels?
Advanced Level qualifications (known as A-Levels) are individual subject based qualifications. They are one option available to students who are looking to study at university. With A-Levels being standalone qualifications, there is no requirement on subject combinations and students’ only constraint is the combinations available within the school timetable. A-Levels are graded from A*-E.
What does this Pathway look like?
Students will usually take 3 or 4 A-Levels and this would be what universities would be looking for as offers are based mainly on 3 A-Level grades. If you are debating which subjects to choose, we recommend you start with 4 A-Levels so you can have a range to begin with which you can narrow down later. Students will receive 6 lessons per subject each week with most subjects being 100% examination-based. Subjects either fit into the category of modular A-Levels or linear A-Levels. In modular subjects, students will take up to three exams in Year 12 and up to three in Year 13 whereas, with linear A-Levels, students complete all exams at the end of Year 13.
How does this Pathway lead to University?
A-Levels are internationally recognised qualifications which will give you access to the most competitive universities worldwide. While taking A-Levels would give you the necessary prerequisites with regards to subjects, you may need to take further tests in English in order to study at universities where courses are delivered in English. In addition, students wishing to study certain subjects worldwide need to review the Mathematics requirements for entry into the university of their choice.
What skills will I develop?
Taking a combination of A-Levels will allow you to specialise in a particular area post 16 as opposed to waiting until you begin university. With few subjects having coursework components, there is a lot of focus on exam skills. However, there is the option of taking the Extended Project Qualification (EPQ) in order to develop your academic writing and research skills. Furthermore, the EPQ is a perfect opportunity for you to demonstrate and develop your interest in an area you want to go on to study at university; competitive universities are always looking for examples of students pursuing their academic passions outside of the classroom. Whether it be the other EPQ or another opportunity, we recommend you find an outlet to explore your passions through extra-curricular activities.

BTECs
A Dynamic BTEC Programme Helping Students Develop Vocational Skills To Move To University Or Into Direct Employment
What are BTECs?
Short for Business and Technology Education Council, BTECs are a practical-based, vocational qualification which offers the same equivalence to A-Levels when converted into UCAS points. Many industry sectors have a set of National Occupational Standards that professionals must follow. The learning content of BTECs is built around these National Occupational Standards, which is why BTECs are recognised as valuable qualifications. They provide the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a field or subject and are an excellent alternative to the more theory focused A-Levels or subjects on the IB Diploma Programme.
What does this Pathway look like?
BTECs are taught through application with students often going on educational visits and meeting industry specialists as well as completing one week of work experience in Year 12. Assessments are via regular coursework and projects throughout the 2-year course. If you know you don’t excel in exam conditions, BTECs can relieve this pressure, spreading out the work that dictates your final grade as 100% of your final grade will come from these coursework components. Students are able to take a combination of BTECs and A-Levels in order to have a balance between hands on learning whilst also taking more traditional subjects.
How does this Pathway lead to University?
BTECs are equivalent to A-Levels in terms of applications to universities. However, there are some universities which don’t accept these qualifications so you would need to research the different countries you would like to apply for in order to ensure you meet the admissions criteria for your desired destination.
What skills will I develop?
BTECs truly prepare students for the real world, offering them practical skills to be successful in the industry of their choosing. If you enjoy practical learning and want to study a specialised range of subjects, BTECs are the perfect option for you. Within each subject, more technical skills are developed; for example, we are very proud of our BTEC Media courses that allow students to create using hi-tech equipment as students learn how to get the most out of this technology.

IB Diploma Programme (IBDP)
Supporting Students To Compete At The Global Level
The mission of the International Baccalaureate Organisation (IBO)’s programmes is to “develop inquiring, knowledgeable and caring young people who help to create a better and more peaceful world through education that builds intercultural understanding and respect.” Sunmarke offers the IB Diploma Programme as this mission aligns with our own to “Nurture the next generation of change-makers for a better tomorrow.” Through its exceptional academic and non-academic initiatives, our school grooms our students to use their education to positively influence their communities. Find out more about the details of the IB Diploma Programme at Sunmarke.
What is the International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme?
The International Baccalaureate Diploma Programme (IBDP) is a holistic programme which gives you a broad post 16 education whilst also allowing you to specialise in three subjects. You will take three Standard Level subjects and three Higher Level subjects as well as the Extended Essay, Theory of Knowledge and the Creativity, Activity and Service Programme (CAS). Each subject is graded from 1-7 with the diploma core (Theory of Knowledge and Extended Essay) giving 3 more points depending on the combination of grades in these components. Students must achieve a minimum total of 24 points to pass the Diploma Programme.
What does this Pathway look like?
Each week you will receive lessons in your 6 subjects (typically 4 lessons for higher level and 3 for standard level) as well as lessons in Theory of Knowledge (TOK). You will also receive sessions to develop writing and research skills needed for the Extended Essay. This is a piece of academic writing where you choose the subject, topic and research question to produce an answer in a 4,000 word research report. The CAS programme is a non-graded component which encourages students to set objectives in creative, active and service experiences outside of the classroom. Each subject has a coursework component worth at least 20% meaning the whole grade does not rest on the final exams.
How does this Pathway lead to University?
An internationally recognised qualification, the IBDP will give you access to the most competitive universities worldwide. With the DP developing more than just subject knowledge, universities see it as a perfect higher education preparation programme. As all students study English Language and Literature, you will meet the language requirement of most universities that deliver courses in English. The IBDP programme also continues a student’s study in Mathematics. Students completing the IBDP programme continue to study Mathematics and English throughout their Secondary education and are then able to demonstrate 4 years of study in Mathematics and English during the application process. The IB Diploma, due to its holistic nature and its requirements, is highly valued by universities worldwide.
What skills will I develop?
Through coursework components, the Extended Essay and Theory of Knowledge, you will learn to think critically, write well constructed, balanced arguments and write using an academic structure. The CAS programme develops skills to ensure you are a well-rounded student who has lots of experiences beyond the classroom to make you really stand out in university applications and interviews.

UNIFROG
Unifrog is the career and university platform that is used at Sunmarke School. It’s an impartial, user-friendly platform that helps students to research their future pathways.
It contains a repository of career lessons, information on pathways, universities around the world, CV builder, personality tests, and links to MOOCs (online courses).
Unifrog is useful for students in their last four years of study but can be accessed and used by all in Secondary. Students can use the platform to start to explore the different post 18 pathways and the application process for their chosen route.
Careers lessons in Y12 focus on psychometric testing, university and career research and to start working on application requirements such as personal statements and US university essays.
We encourage all families to explore this platform together as early as possible in order to start the conversation as to where a student may study as well as what the course requirements are in order to make sure the right combination of subjects are being chosen post 16. There are many factors that go into shortlisting universities such as location, size, tuition fees or university housing to name just a few; with all this choice, it is important to narrow down to specific countries in Year 12 so the application process is not overwhelming in Year 13.
Students work one-on-one with the university careers counsellors who assist and guide students through every step of the application process.

1. What are the changes to the age requirements for entry to Sunmarke School?
Age requirements will change for new students enroled into FS1, according to the UAE Ministry of Education Resolution no (24).
Children enroling into FS1, starting in September, must be three years old on or before the 31st of August.
Children enroling into FS2, starting in September, must be four years old on or before the 31st of August.
Similarly, children enroling into Year 1, starting school in September, must be five years old on or before the 31st of August.
The MOE resolution stipulates that all students currently enroled at private schools in the UAE are not affected by the change. This includes students who enrol for the final term of the 2023/24  academic year.

2. When did this change come into effect?
This change was applicable from the start of the 2021/22 academic year in September 2021.
3. Why was this change made?
This decision was made to bring more consistency to the cut-off dates used by schools in the UAE with those used by schools abroad. For example, UK schools in the UAE will now have the same cut-off date as schools in the UK, and international British schools.
4.Who will this change impact?
This change will impact children up to six years old who are enrolling in school for the first time.
5. Will the new cut-off date apply to all year groups?
It will apply to new students enrolling in FS1, FS2, Year 1 and Year 2 in all schools in the UAE, as stipulated in the MOE resolution.
6. My child was born in October and is now in FS1 – I want to enrol him in another school for FS2. Can I do this or does he have to repeat a year?
Because your child is already enroled in school, the new cut-off dates in the MOE resolution do not apply. He does not have to repeat the year.
7. My son was enroled in FS1 this year but I withdrew his enrolment due to COVID-19. He’ll be 3 years old in September. Can I still enrol him in FS2 next year?
Your child must have formally finished the previous academic year in order to enrol in the next one. Since he does not meet the age requirement for FS2 for next academic year, he must enrol in FS1. According to the MOE resolution, he can enrol in FS2 next academic year only if he completes FS1 this academic year.
8. My daughter will be 4 years old in December. If I enrol her in FS2 for the last term of this year – before the changes come into effect – will she be able to start Year 1 next year?
Yes. The new age requirements will apply for new students from the start of the next academic year only. The MOE resolution stipulates that all students currently enroled at private schools in the UAE are not affected by the change.
9. I’ve already registered and paid the deposit for my daughter to start school in FS2 in September. She will be four years old in November. Is she affected by this?
According to the new cut-off dates in the MOE resolution, your daughter will not be able to start in FS2 in September. Alternatively, we would be happy to transfer your child’s application to their age-appropriate year group (FS1) and register your child for this year group instead.
Parents whose children are affected by the new cut-off dates and who have already paid deposits for their children’s enrolment are entitled to a refund if they wish.
10. My child was born one day after the cut-off date. Is there some leeway given?
No exceptions to the cut-off dates will be given under any circumstances
